channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @heyadiana @Cato_of_Utica Nationalize the national pastime.
@bernstein_judah Welcome to the Problem Solver‚Äôs Caucus!
Somewhere, Louis Brandeis weeps. https://t.co/4ZHX7Mzvt5
@datadivajf Cancelled, like his creator Chabon, for supporting the New Israel Fund?
A very important meditation on the uses and abuses of religious tradition ‚Äî and the rhetoric of our would-be authoritarian rulers. https://t.co/ULbDwUsCSo

This is what happens when you let Republicans, a party whose base includes religious extremists who want us all to meet Jesus as soon as possible, have power in the government. https://t.co/nQDYQhOHCn
@rmneiss @PrivacyWatchSTL They‚Äôre on to you.

@Shmarya I‚Äôd say that the awkwardly named ideology called ‚Äúpro-Israelism‚Äù is the problem, and the heresy.
@Shmarya States are problematic and in need of constant critique, as exemplified by the Biblical prophets. Zionism was about building power. Pro-Israelism is about defending and expanding power to the exclusion of other values.
@datadivajf You'd think by the 24th century you would be able to ingest nicotine without harming your lungs. I dunno, some sort of nicotine gum or edible....

@datadivajf Given that it's a neo-pre-seat-belt society, the shocker is that there aren't ash trays at all the consoles.
@datadivajf Was seatbelt technology lost in WWIII? Or was it never invented, perhaps as a result of McCoy's travel back to early 20th century NYC?
@eddyportnoy @onthemainline Definitely need a listicle of JTA Neologisms That Failed to Catch On.
@EladNehorai ‚ÄúJudaism is already great.‚Äù

@MisfitTorah @AvBronstein I suppose I need to send him a copy of this book üìñ published, in the dim hope that first-person accounts of the downsides of growing up as a frum girl might influence his ideology. https://t.co/9UtgxrnTPv

@HannahLebovits @cwjisrael A real cynic would look at the role agunot have in performing sacrifice in a community that by and large no longer has to sacrifice material well being (with the possible exception of yeshiva tuition) to maintain their religious observance.
@HannahLebovits @cwjisrael And whether the price of losing that performance motivates Orthodox rabbinic leaders who loudly champion social media campaigns while quietly and effectively sabotaging innovative halachic solutions.
@GenJones1964 @daveschechter @dick_nixon Fuller context: https://t.co/FzRRnmNY55
Counterpoint: A Christian theocracy in the US would increase American Jewish identity and aliyah. https://t.co/fRJ6Tbp63p
@daveschechter @dick_nixon Speaking of marijuana‚Ä¶. https://t.co/K44UH2gc52
@AvBronstein Can you link to Eis?
@trekonomics Do I recall correctly that he‚Äôs a history truther now? Or was that someone else?
@YehudahMirsky Good thing that Democratic party‚Äúmoderates‚Äù stood firm against Biden undoing the former guy‚Äôs tax cuts.
"Shared democratic values" https://t.co/r0SUwFPNQo

@Shmarya Great! So he‚Äôll know where the money is buried, and can get to work immediately in turning the apartments into affordable housing, right?
@Shmarya (I expect only the best from recent Bergen County residents!)
@smbahr14 @THECITYNY Time to nationalize the national pastime in the public interest.
Ringo tried to warn us. https://t.co/eBazrKDJPk
